p: Extracts of polypore mushrooms native to North America have been shown to have antiviral activities against viruses that attack honeybees [ 51]. Mycelium extracts from Fomes fomentarius collected in Ithaca (NY, USA) and Ganoderma resinaceum culture from Ontario (Canada) were found to reduce the levels of honeybee deformed wing virus and Lake Sinai virus in vivo in both laboratory and field studies [ 51].
